intro: Perymenium subcordatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perymenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
